DOC.brief_summary: This study design test whether two zeaxanthin formulation ( supplement contain different nutritional compound zeaxanthin omega fatty acid primary ingredient interest ) influence visual motor function . Visual motor function refers process speed visual system individual respond behavioral visual stimulus ( e.g. , reaction time ) .
DOC.brief_title: The Effects Zeaxanthin Intervention Visuomotor Function
DOC.detailed_description: This study design test whether two zeaxanthin formulation ( supplement contain different nutritional compound zeaxanthin omega fatty acid primary ingredient interest ) influence visual motor function . Visual motor function refers process speed visual system individual respond behavioral visual stimulus ( e.g. , reaction time ) .
DOC.criteria: Age : ≥18 ≤ 40 year BMI : ≥ 20 ≤ 30 kg/m2 No anticipate change diet habit ( relevant intake xanthophyll fats/oils ) . No anticipated surgical procedure . Willingness ability give write informed consent willingness ability comply study requirement . Corrected visual acuity ( ETDRS ) : better 20/60 eye select study Smokers Current history relevant ocular disease ( AMD ) condition e.g. , lipid disorder . Inability reliably perform macular pigment optical density measurement `` Heterochromatic Flicker Photometry '' ophthalmic test study . Any condition likely interfere normal gastrointestinal absorption xanthophyll ( e.g. , digestive disorder : inflammatory bowel disease , ulcerative colitis , Crohn 's , irritable bowel , etc . lipid disorder include condition hypercholesterolemia ) Current use xanthophyll contain supplement use xanthophyll containing supplement past 6 month ( exclude multivitamin contain lutein zeaxanthin low potency ) . Participation study last 1 month study initiation . Known hypersensitivity allergy xanthophyll . Regular intake medication supplement , principal investigator deem likely confound study outcome . These include diabetes medication statin drug/supplement modulate cholesterol fat digestion/absorption .
